Urgent MRI and vascular imaging are required to define the optic nerve and cerebellar lesions and distinguish demyelinating from ischaemic or compressive pathology. Markedly elevated inflammatory markers and age >50 necessitate prompt evaluation for vasculitis (especially giant cell arteritis) alongside CSF, autoimmune, and infectious studies to clarify the aetiology. Detailed visual assessment establishes baseline function, while systemic and safety blood tests guide subsequent immunotherapy or antithrombotic treatment.
